name: Rainbow Elders Calgary
context: Title: Rainbow Elders Calgary | Content: Calgary Pride Parade, August 31, 2025 Rainbow Elders Calgary members Nia and Tina were proud Pride Parade marshals this year! Rainbow Elders Calgary is a volunteer-run, non-profit organization determined to make a significant difference in the lives of 2SLGBTQ+ seniors. We know that social isolation and loneliness are major issues for aging members of our gay community. Therefore, we work to provide support and friendship by organizing safe social events such as: picnics in the park; coffee socials; evenings out and monthly meetups where folk can chat, be themselves and feel safe. Visit our About Us page for more details and information! _ rainbowelderscalgary@gmail.com Mailing address: Rainbow Elders Calgary, c/o Centre for Sexuality Suite 700 - 1509 Centre Street S Calgary Alberta T2G 2E6 Don't miss anything! Our community is brought together by adults who simply want to have more play in their week. Our only ask to participate is an inclusive, open attitude that is welcoming to all types of people, athletic ability and care for how you show up to have fun. It‚Äôs a long journey to create a more just and equitable world. It takes courage, persistence, and, most importantly, it takes all of us. On Tuesday, November 18, Janet H. delivered a well-researched and passionate presentation on Mark Twain. Janet examined the man, the writer, and Huckleberry Finn‚Äôs lasting place in modern literature. Twain‚Äôs writings address the horrors and injustices of slavery, and Janet handled this sensitive subject with care and insight. name: More Neighbours Calgary
context: Title: More Neighbours Calgary | Content: More homes, more opportunity. More Neighbours Calgary is changing the conversation on housing. Join the Discord Get the Newsletter Howdy Neighbour! Defenders of the status quo dominate public discourse on housing. More Neighbours Calgary is committed to making Calgary a 21st century city. We provide a strong voice in support of sustainable housing growth. Calgary has a long history of affordability with seemingly limitless supply. Now, our housing advantage is disappearing, as prices rise and supply shrinks. Car-centric neighbourhoods and a sprawling footprint are adding to the social, economic and climate impacts. We need all types of homes, for all shapes and sizes of families , in all parts of the city. The housing crises of Toronto and Vancouver are on our doorstep. It‚Äôs time we stop limiting much-needed housing. Housing is a basic need and every Calgarian should have a safe place to call home. Our mission is to stand against the injustices Palestinians face | Content: About Us Watermelon Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to championing Palestinian rights and heritage. By amplifying marginalized voices, fostering understanding, and building bridges of solidarity, we confront injustice and strive for a future where dignity, justice, and cultural appreciation thrive. Our Mission Our mission is to raise awareness of Palestinian history and culture, advocate against injustices, and collaborate with individuals and organizations that share our vision. We believe education and activism can drive meaningful change and create a more equitable world. Words like ‚Äúgay‚Äù or ‚Äúbi‚Äù are familiar to most people, but when it comes to the ‚ÄúA‚Äù spectrum of identities, many do not recognize that these even exist. Few people have a basic understanding of what it really means to be asexual or aromantic, or that they are valid orientations which are part of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community and face societal discrimination. Thus, outreach and education are important to those who fall within the asexual and aromantic spectrums. The Society of Asexuals and Aromantics of Alberta (SAAA) was founded to allow us to be visible, to represent who we are, and to spread awareness. We provide a valuable safe space for a-specs to form community in Alberta, and pursue opportunities for education, advocacy, and public outreach. context: Title: Urban Planning Committee - Federation of Calgary Communities | Meta: Urban Planning Committee Share your voice Our Urban Planning Committee is a forum for open discussion on pre-determined planning topics. We meet every second month and include a mix of regular and rotational (topic-specific) members. Our planning team facilitates these discussions, providing a supportive and respectful platform for members to share their diverse perspectives and expertise. By exploring diverse perspectives, we gain a deeper understanding of community needs and the practical challenges of implementing planning strategies. This knowledge empowers us to effectively support community association planning committees as they navigate similar discussions. Collaborative Learning Open Dialogue Exchanging Knowledge Addressing Trends Join our Urban Planning Commitee! Our regular members convene every two months to discuss the most recent developments in the industry. Regular committee members will go through a nomination process with the Federation of Calgary Communities Board. Rotational Members (3-5 positions available per topic) Passionate about a particular urban planning issue? Do you have specialized knowledge in a specific field? context: Title: Protospace ‚Äì We make space so you can make things. | Content: Protospace is Calgary‚Äôs non-profit makerspace. We have a community wood shop , metal shop , sewing room , 3D printers , laser cutters , electronics lab , and much more . We are a quirky, fun community where artists, makers and geeks come together to share our knowledge, equipment and ideas. We have no owners, shareholders, employees, or staff. We always welcome new members, everyone from beginners to experts and everything in between. Come build something with us today!
